item.title: Spoke add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Jess C Scott
item.description: "Friends are the family you choose (~ Nin/Ithilnin, Elven rogue)." -- Jess C Scott

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description:
"About once or twice every month I engage in public debates with those whose pressing need it is to woo and to win the approval of supernatural beings. Very often, when I give my view that there is no supernatural dimension, and certainly not one that is only or especially available to the faithful, and that the natural world is wonderful enough—and even miraculous enough if you insist—I attract pitying looks and anxious questions. How, in that case, I am asked, do I find meaning and purpose in life? How does a mere and gross materialist, with no expectation of a life to come, decide what, if anything, is worth caring about?
Depending on my mood, I sometimes but not always refrain from pointing out what a breathtakingly insulting and patronizing question this is. (It is on a par with the equally subtle inquiry: Since you don't believe in our god, what stops you from stealing and lying and raping and killing to your heart's content?) Just as the answer to the latter question is: self-respect and the desire for the respect of others—while in the meantime it is precisely those who think they have divine permission who are truly capable of any atrocity—so the answer to the first question falls into two parts. A life that partakes even a little of friendship, love, irony, humor, parenthood, literature, and music, and the chance to take part in battles for the liberation of others cannot be called 'meaningless' except if the person living it is also an existentialist and elects to call it so. It could be that all existence is a pointless joke, but it is not in fact possible to live one's everyday life as if this were so. Whereas if one sought to define meaninglessness and futility, the idea that a human life should be expended in the guilty, fearful, self-obsessed propitiation of supernatural nonentities… but there, there. Enough." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Sophie Kinsella
item.description: "We’re on this planet for too short a time. And at the end of the day, what’s more important? Knowing that a few meaningless figures balanced—or knowing that you were the person you wanted to be?" -- Sophie Kinsella

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Rumi Jalalud-Din
item.description: "Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death." -- Rumi Jalalud-Din

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection" -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Karen E. Quinones Miller
item.description: "When someone tells me "no," it doesn't mean I can't do it, it simply means I can't do it with them." -- Karen E. Quinones Miller

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Tricia Cunningham
item.description: "The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it." -- Tricia Cunningham

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "The firmest friendships have been formed in mutual adversity, as iron is most strongly united by the fiercest flame" -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Chad Michael Murray
item.description: "Our biggest regrets are not for the things we have done but for the things we haven't done" -- Chad Michael Murray

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration. " -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Spoke add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Federico Fellini
item.description: "All art is autobiographical; the pearl is the oyster's autobiography." -- Federico Fellini

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "We live in a world where joy and empathy and pleasure are all around us, there for the noticing." -- Ira Glass

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Hayao Miyazaki
item.description: "You must see with eyes unclouded by hate. See the good in that which is evil, and the evil in that which is good. Pledge yourself to neither side, but vow instead to preserve the balance that exists between the two." -- Hayao Miyazaki

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Joseph Pulitzer
item.description: "There is not a crime, there is not a dodge, there is not a trick, there is not a swindle, there is not a vice which does not live by secrecy." -- Joseph Pulitzer

item.title: Spoke add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Benjamin Spock
item.description: "Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do." -- Benjamin Spock

item.title: Spoke add a quote by John Cheever
item.description: "I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be." -- John Cheever

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible." -- Norton Juster

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Spoke add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help." -- Bill Watterson
